init_text:
Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion,

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: have the responsibility to keep themselves well informed.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: they can actively participate in their own government (i.e., vote).

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: a citizen will be unable to participate in meaningful ways to change an issue or even know where they stand on an issue.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: if you don't know what a bill is, how are you supposed to make an informed vote on it (legislation)?

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: responsibly make a decision when a politician says that global warming doesn't exist (climate change)?

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: you don't know where your country stands on the world stage, how can you intelligently weigh in on the validity of foreign policies?

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: living in our modern era, we are often privy to information that can be quite overwhelming, and it is easy to simply choose to look the other

actions.name: text-delete
actions.text: it is easy to simply choose to look the other

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: look at different media outlets, news stories and fact-check them, in order to be well-informed.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: being exposed to a distorted narrative that either intentionally, or inadvertently, creates misinformation and post-factual situations; e.g., when one narrative sets

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: , actively shuts us out from the process of making informed choices about issues, in a systemic way.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: we have the ability to harness these techniques, through social media, and this can give birth to powerful democratic forces that can create real change in politics.
